title: Umbrella Prints Logotype
content:
I’ve found a fairly distinctive and so far rather elusive face.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20080907014313im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/umbrellaprints_4276.gif)

I’d really appreciate any leads. Thanks. Cameron

 [‹ GO! St. Alfred Baseball Cap FONT ID](http://web.archive.org/web/20080907014313/http:/www.typophile.com/node/46235 "Go to previous forum topic") [Markeur Digitized ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080907014313/http:/www.typophile.com/node/46182 "Go to next forum topic")
author: Tromley

comments.content:
I don’t know if it’s a font, but I’d say it was inspired by:

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20080907014313im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/logotipo_res_4272.gif)

’ [Espanglés](http://web.archive.org/web/20080907014313/http:/www.haroldsfonts.com/espangles.html)’, by Harold Lohner, which would — of course — be inspired by the ’El Corte Inglés’ logotype. _( [Available from Font Bros.](http://web.archive.org/web/20080907014313/http:/www.fontbros.com/cgi-bin/commerce.cgi?key=HAFO-ESPA&preadd=action))_

A ’sadlyenoughnotasquirky’ alternate may be ’Futura Script’.

Dav
Nice assist Nick. And thanks Dav for the link. You’ve made my day.
Nice assist Nick. And thanks Dav for the link. You’ve made my day.
